llm_interactions.input_prompt:
# Expert Survey Designer and Market Research Specialist

## Your Expertise:
- Market research methodology design with 15+ years experience
- Question design and survey optimization
- Statistical analysis and data quality assurance
- Industry best practices and compliance standards

## Core Design Principles:
- Prioritize data quality and respondent experience
- Design surveys that are clear, unbiased, and actionable
- Follow established research methodologies rigorously
- Ensure questions are specific, measurable, and relevant
- Maintain logical flow and appropriate question sequencing

## Methodology Requirements:

### Measures preferences for product attributes:
- Required Questions: 0
- Validation Rules: Must have balanced choice sets; Attributes must be orthogonal (independent); Include appropriate sample size calculations; Use realistic attribute levels; Include 'None of the above' option

### Measures price sensitivity through four key questions:
- Required Questions: 4
- Validation Rules: Must have exactly 4 price questions; Questions must follow the exact Van Westendorp format; Price ranges should be logical and sequential; Include open-ended follow-up for reasoning; Use currency-appropriate formatting


## 5-PILLAR EVALUATION FRAMEWORK:
Follow these comprehensive rules to ensure high-quality survey design:


## Content Validity (20% Weight)
Follow these core quality standards:
- ðŸ”´ Include sufficient screening questions to identify and qualify the target respondent population
  â€¢ Design screening questions early in survey flow
  â€¢ Ensure screening criteria match target population definition
- ðŸ”´ Ensure the questionnaire comprehensively covers all essential research objectives stated in the RFQ document
  â€¢ Review all RFQ objectives carefully before question design
  â€¢ Map each research objective to specific survey questions
- ðŸ”´ Include appropriate and sufficient demographic questions for target audience analysis
  â€¢ Consider age, gender, income, geography as relevant to research goals
  â€¢ Include occupation, education level when business-relevant
- ðŸŸ¡ Include validation questions or consistency checks to verify response reliability
- ðŸ”´ Address information needs of all key stakeholders identified in the research
  â€¢ Identify all stakeholders mentioned in RFQ
  â€¢ Ensure questions address each stakeholder's information needs
- ðŸŸ¡ Ensure questions capture data at the appropriate level of detail for analysis requirements
- ðŸ”µ Design questions to comprehensively cover the breadth and depth of the research domain
- ðŸ”µ Include questions that address both current state and future intentions or behaviors
- ðŸ”µ Design questions to capture nuanced and context-specific information when required
- ðŸ”µ Ensure cultural sensitivity and appropriateness for the target demographic
- ðŸ”µ Include questions that support triangulation and cross-validation of key findings

## Methodological Rigor (25% Weight)
Follow these core quality standards:
- ðŸ”´ Use methodologically sound question types appropriate for the specific data collection needs
  â€¢ Match question types to data requirements (categorical, ordinal, interval)
  â€¢ Use established question formats for validated constructs
- ðŸ”´ Include appropriate sample size considerations and statistical power requirements
  â€¢ Consider minimum sample size for intended analysis
  â€¢ Include sample size guidance in survey metadata
- ðŸ”´ Design questions to minimize measurement error and response bias
  â€¢ Use neutral, unbiased question wording
  â€¢ Avoid leading or loaded questions
- ðŸ”´ Include appropriate control questions and randomization where methodologically required
  â€¢ Add control questions for experimental designs
  â€¢ Include randomization instructions where needed
- ðŸ”´ Ensure response scales and formats are consistent with established research practices
  â€¢ Use standard Likert scales (5-point, 7-point) where appropriate
  â€¢ Maintain consistent scale directions throughout survey
- ðŸŸ¡ Include questions that enable reliability and validity testing of key constructs
- ðŸŸ¡ Design survey structure to minimize order effects and response patterns
- ðŸŸ¡ Include appropriate benchmarking questions for result contextualization
- ðŸ”µ Design questions to support rigorous statistical analysis and hypothesis testing
- ðŸ”µ Include questions that address potential confounding variables and alternative explanations
- ðŸ”µ Ensure survey design supports the intended generalizability of findings
- ðŸ”µ Include temporal considerations and time-sensitive questions where methodologically relevant
- ðŸ”µ Design questions to minimize social desirability bias and demand characteristics
- ðŸ”µ Include appropriate pilot testing and validation recommendations in survey metadata
- ðŸ”µ Ensure survey methodology aligns with industry standards and best practices

## Clarity & Comprehensibility (25% Weight)
Follow these core quality standards:
- ðŸ”´ Write all questions using clear, unambiguous language that is easily understood by the target audience
  â€¢ Use simple, direct language appropriate for target demographic
  â€¢ Avoid ambiguous terms that could be interpreted multiple ways
- ðŸ”´ Avoid unnecessary technical jargon and define technical terms when they must be used
  â€¢ Use plain language instead of technical jargon where possible
  â€¢ Provide clear definitions for necessary technical terms
- ðŸ”´ Ensure response options are mutually exclusive and collectively exhaustive
  â€¢ Design response options that don't overlap
  â€¢ Include all reasonable response possibilities
- ðŸ”´ Provide clear, comprehensive instructions for completing each question type
  â€¢ Include specific instructions for complex question types
  â€¢ Explain how to use scales, rankings, or special formats
- ðŸ”´ Use consistent terminology and question formats throughout the survey
  â€¢ Maintain consistent terms for the same concepts
  â€¢ Use consistent question format patterns
- ðŸ”´ Design questions to avoid double-barreled, leading, or loaded constructions
  â€¢ Ask about one concept per question
  â€¢ Use neutral wording that doesn't suggest preferred answers
- ðŸŸ¡ Structure questions with appropriate cognitive load for target respondents
- ðŸ”µ Design question wording to be culturally appropriate and accessible across diverse populations
- ðŸ”µ Ensure readability level is appropriate for the target demographic
- ðŸ”µ Use examples and clarifications to enhance question understanding when needed
- ðŸ”µ Design scales and response formats that are intuitive and easy to use
- ðŸ”µ Ensure questions can be understood without requiring extensive context from previous questions
- ðŸ”µ Use active voice and direct language to improve question clarity and engagement

## Structural Coherence (20% Weight)
Follow these core quality standards:
- ðŸ”´ Organize questions in a logical, coherent flow that guides respondents naturally through the survey
  â€¢ Start with general questions and move to specific
  â€¢ Group related questions together logically
- ðŸ”´ Structure survey sections in a logical sequence that supports the research objectives
  â€¢ Organize sections to build understanding progressively
  â€¢ Place screening questions early in survey
- ðŸ”´ Implement appropriate skip logic and branching to maintain survey relevance for all respondents
  â€¢ Design skip logic to avoid irrelevant questions
  â€¢ Create clear branching paths for different respondent types
- ðŸ”´ Balance survey length appropriately for the target audience and research depth required
  â€¢ Consider target audience attention span
  â€¢ Balance comprehensiveness with completion rates
- ðŸŸ¡ Create clear section breaks and transitions that help respondents understand survey structure
- ðŸŸ¡ Ensure consistent question numbering and formatting throughout the survey
- ðŸ”µ Design survey structure to minimize respondent fatigue and maintain engagement
- ðŸ”µ Implement appropriate question dependencies and relationships throughout the survey
- ðŸ”µ Create a survey structure that facilitates efficient data analysis and interpretation
- ðŸ”µ Balance the distribution of different question types throughout the survey
- ðŸ”µ Design survey structure to accommodate different completion scenarios and timeframes
- ðŸ”µ Ensure survey structure supports quality assurance and data validation processes

## Deployment Readiness (10% Weight)
Follow these core quality standards:
- ðŸ”´ Provide clear, comprehensive instructions for survey respondents and administrators
  â€¢ Include detailed respondent instructions
  â€¢ Provide administrator guidance where needed
- ðŸ”´ Design questions to be mobile-friendly and accessible across different devices and platforms
  â€¢ Ensure questions work well on mobile devices
  â€¢ Consider accessibility requirements
- ðŸ”´ Include appropriate time estimates and progress indicators in survey design
  â€¢ Provide realistic completion time estimates
  â€¢ Design for progress tracking
- ðŸŸ¡ Design survey with appropriate error handling and validation mechanisms
- ðŸ”µ Include appropriate privacy and data handling information in survey design
- ðŸ”µ Design survey to facilitate efficient data collection and management processes
- ðŸ”µ Include testing recommendations and quality assurance guidelines for survey deployment

## CONTEXTUAL KNOWLEDGE:
Based on 3 high-quality similar surveys retrieved via semantic matching:
- Average quality score: 0.92
- Primary methodologies: conjoint, vw, choice_modeling, cbc, van_westendorp, gg, pricing, gabor_granger
- Similarity range: 0.436 - 0.633
- Common patterns and best practices have been incorporated into the framework above


## CURRENT RFQ:
**Title:** Request for Quotation (RFQ): Quantitative Market Research for Contact Lens Pricing â€” AIR OPTIX plus HydraGlyde Pricing Study
**Description:** Alcon seeks proposals to conduct a comprehensive quantitative pricing study for the recently launched AIR OPTIX plus HydraGlyde monthly contact lens to determine optimal price points, assess price acceptance and elasticity, and inform premium positioning in the competitive contact lens market.

---

## Research Objectives:
1. Determine optimal price points across segments
2. Identify price sensitivity thresholds and acceptable ranges
3. Establish competitive pricing benchmarks vs. premium monthly lenses
4. Assess willingness to pay at various price levels
5. Evaluate price elasticity of demand
6. Determine conversion probability at different price points
7. Understand perceived value of HydraGlyde Moisture Matrix and SmartShield Technology
8. Measure price-to-benefit ratio acceptance
9. Identify value drivers that justify premium pricing
10. Analyze price sensitivity by age, income, gender
11. Evaluate regional price acceptance variations
12. Identify high-value segments with lower price sensitivity
13. Compare price acceptance vs. competing brands and assess brand equity impact
14. Determine competitive advantages supporting premium positioning
15. Quantify monetary value of specific product benefits
16. Identify most compelling features by segment
17. Assess willingness to pay premium for innovative technologies

**Success Metrics**: Achieve target sample size with specified quotas at 95% confidence and Â±3-4% MOE; robust subgroup analysis; clear identification of optimal price points, acceptable ranges, and elasticity; actionable competitive pricing benchmarks.
**Measurement Approach**: Mixed Methods

## Target Audience:
- **Research Audience**: 800-1,200 respondents comprising 70% current contact lens wearers (18-45, focus 25-34) and 30% new adopters (18-34); 60% female/40% male; middle to upper-middle income; urban 60% / suburban 30% / regional 10%; experience mix includes monthly wearers, daily/weekly, infrequent, and non-users considering adoption.

## Methodology Preferences:
- **Primary Method**: gabor_granger
- **Complexity Level**: Standard
- **Sample Size Target**: 400-600 respondents

## Business Context:
- **Background**: Monthly silicone hydrogel contact lenses (Vision Care)
- **Stakeholder Requirements**: Quality controls including attention, speed, and consistency checks; mobile-optimized survey; strict demographic and income quotas; ensure mix of contact lens experience levels.
- **Budget Range**: 10k 50k
- **Timeline Constraints**: Standard

## Survey Requirements:
- **Required Sections**: Screener, Demographics, Awareness, Usage, Concept Testing, Pricing, Satisfaction
- **Target Completion Time**: 15-25_ minutes
- **Device Compatibility**: Both
- **Accessibility Requirements**: Standard
- **Data Quality Requirements**: Standard

## Classification & Compliance:
- **Industry**: Healthcare
- **Respondent Type**: B2B
- **Methodology Tags**: Quantitative, Concept Testing
- **Compliance Requirements**: GDPR Compliance

**Category:** None
**Target Segment:** 800-1,200 respondents comprising 70% current contact lens wearers (18-45, focus 25-34) and 30% new adopters (18-34); 60% female/40% male; middle to upper-middle income; urban 60% / suburban 30% / regional 10%; experience mix includes monthly wearers, daily/weekly, infrequent, and non-users considering adoption.
**Research Goal:** General market research


## CRITICAL REQUIREMENT - SECTIONS FORMAT:
ðŸš¨ MANDATORY: Generate survey using SECTIONS format with exactly 7 sections
ðŸš¨ MANDATORY: Return ONLY valid JSON - NO markdown, explanations, or additional text
ðŸš¨ MANDATORY: Start response with { and end with } - this is the ONLY format accepted

## SECTION ORGANIZATION:
1. **Sample Plan** (id: 1): Participant qualification criteria, recruitment requirements, and quotas
2. **Screener** (id: 2): Initial qualification questions and basic demographics
3. **Brand/Product Awareness & Usage** (id: 3): Brand recall, awareness funnel, and usage patterns
4. **Concept Exposure** (id: 4): Product/concept introduction and reaction assessment
5. **Methodology** (id: 5): Research-specific questions (Conjoint, Pricing, Feature Importance)
6. **Additional Questions** (id: 6): Supplementary research questions and follow-ups
7. **Programmer Instructions** (id: 7): Technical implementation notes and data specifications

## JSON FORMATTING RULES:
âœ… All strings in double quotes, proper syntax, no trailing commas
âœ… Section IDs are numbers (1,2,3,4,5,6,7), Question IDs are strings (q1,q2,q3)
âœ… All question text on single lines - NO newlines within strings
âœ… No markdown formatting, bullet points, or special characters in text

## REQUIRED JSON STRUCTURE:
{
  "title": "Survey Title",
  "description": "Survey Description",
  "sections": [
    {
      "id": 1,
      "title": "Sample Plan",
      "description": "Participant qualification criteria, recruitment requirements, and quotas",
      "introText": {
        "id": "intro_1",
        "type": "study_intro",
        "content": "Thank you for agreeing to participate in this study...",
        "mandatory": true,
        "label": "Study_Intro"
      },
      "questions": [
        {
          "id": "q1",
          "text": "Question text on single line",
          "type": "multiple_choice",
          "options": [
            "Option 1",
            "Option 2"
          ],
          "required": true,
          "methodology": "screening",
          "order": 1
        }
      ]
    },
    {
      "id": 2,
      "title": "Screener",
      "description": "Initial qualification questions and basic demographics",
      "questions": []
    },
    {
      "id": 3,
      "title": "Brand/Product Awareness & Usage",
      "description": "Brand recall, awareness funnel, and usage patterns",
      "textBlocks": [
        {
          "id": "text_3",
          "type": "product_usage",
          "content": "Before we begin, please tell us about your experience...",
          "mandatory": true,
          "label": "Product_Usage"
        }
      ],
      "questions": []
    },
    {
      "id": 4,
      "title": "Concept Exposure",
      "description": "Product/concept introduction and reaction assessment",
      "introText": {
        "id": "intro_4",
        "type": "concept_intro",
        "content": "Please review the following concept carefully...",
        "mandatory": true,
        "label": "Concept_Intro"
      },
      "questions": []
    },
    {
      "id": 5,
      "title": "Methodology",
      "description": "Research-specific questions (Conjoint, Pricing, Feature Importance)",
      "questions": []
    },
    {
      "id": 6,
      "title": "Additional Questions",
      "description": "Supplementary research questions and follow-ups",
      "questions": []
    },
    {
      "id": 7,
      "title": "Programmer Instructions",
      "description": "Technical implementation notes and data specifications",
      "questions": []
    }
  ],
  "metadata": {
    "estimated_time": 10,
    "methodology_tags": [
      "methodology"
    ],
    "target_responses": 100,
    "sections_count": 7
  }
}

llm_interactions.output_content:
{
  "title": "AIR OPTIX plus HydraGlyde Pricing Study",
  "description": "Quantitative pricing study to determine optimal pricing,price sensitivity,and value drivers for AIR OPTIX plus HydraGlyde monthly contact lenses.",
  "sections": [
    {
      "id": 1,
      "title": "Sample Plan",
      "description": "Participant qualification criteria,recruitment requirements,and quotas",
      "introText": {
        "id": "intro_1",
        "type": "study_intro",
        "content": "Thank you for agreeing to participate in this study about contact lenses. Your responses are confidential and will be used for research purposes only.",
        "mandatory": true,
        "label": "Study_Intro"
      },
      "questions": [
        {
          "id": "q1",
          "text": "Target market definition:Recruit adults ages 18-45 (70% current contact lens wearers) and 18-34 considering contact lenses (30% prospective adopters); gender 60% female and 40% male; income middle to upper-middle; geography 60% urban,30% suburban,10% regional; ensure mix of monthly,daily/weekly,infrequent users,and non-users considering adoption.",
          "type": "instruction",
          "options": [],
          "required": true,
          "methodology": "screening",
          "order": 1
        },
        {
          "id": "q2",
          "text": "Sample size and power:Target n=400-600 completes with quotas to enable \u00b14-5% MOE overall and subgroup analysis by age,gender,income,and region; include plan to reach 800-1,200 total if budget allows; minimum n=100 per key subgroup for pricing curves where feasible.",
          "type": "instruction",
          "options": [],
          "required": true,
          "methodology": "sampling",
          "order": 2
        },
        {
          "id": "q3",
          "text": "Quotas:70% current wearers; 30% prospective adopters; Age 18-24:20-25%,25-34:35-40%,35-45:35-40% (wearers only); Gender female 60%,male 40%; Income middle 50-60%,upper-middle 40-50%; Geography urban 60%,suburban 30%,regional 10%; Experience mix monthly 40-50%,daily 25-35%,weekly/biweekly 10-20%,infrequent 10-15%.",
          "type": "instruction",
          "options": [],
          "required": true,
          "methodology": "quotas",
          "order": 3
        },
        {
          "id": "q4",
          "text": "Quality controls:Include attention checks,speeders removal (below 1/3 median time),straight-lining flags,inconsistent response checks,and duplicate IP/device prevention; device mix minimum 60% mobile-compatible.",
          "type": "instruction",
          "options": [],
          "required": true,
          "methodology": "quality_control",
          "order": 4
        },
        {

          "type": "instruction",

          "order": 5
        }
      ]
    },
    {
      "id": 2,

      "introText": {

            "Very clear",
            "Extremely clear"

        },

          "options": [
            "All-day moisture",
            "Deposit resistance",
            "Comfort throughout the month",
            "Clarity of vision",
            "Eye health protection",
            "Brand reputation",
            "Price-value promise",
            "Other"
          ],
          "required": true,

          "order": 3
        },
        {
          "id": "q4",
          "text": "In your own words,what stands out most about this product and why?",
          "type": "open_text",
          "options": [],
          "required": false,
          "methodology": "qual_feedback",
          "order": 4
        }
      ]
    },
    {
      "id": 5,
      "title": "Methodology",
      "description": "Research-specific questions (Conjoint,Pricing,Feature Importance)",
      "questions": [
        {

    {
      "id": 6,
      "title": "Additional Questions",
      "description": "Supplementary research questions and follow-ups",
      "questions": [
        {
          "id": "q1",
          "text": "Compared to competing premium monthly lenses,how would you rate AIR OPTIX plus HydraGlyde on overall value for money?",
          "type": "single_choice",
          "options": [
            "Much worse value",
            "Somewhat worse value",
            "About the same value",
            "Somewhat better value",
            "Much better value",
            "Not sure"
          ],
          "required": true,
          "methodology": "comparative_value",
          "order": 1
        },
        {
          "id": "q2",
          "text": "If priced at your preferred price,what is the likelihood you would purchase AIR OPTIX plus HydraGlyde within the next 3 months?",
          "type": "single_choice",
          "options": [
            "0-10% chance",
            "11-30% chance",
            "31-50% chance",
            "51-70% chance",
            "71-90% chance",
            "91-100% chance"

    {
      "id": 7,
      "title": "Programmer Instructions",
      "description": "Technical implementation notes and data specifications",
      "questions": [
        {
          "id": "q1",
          "text": "Screening logic:Terminate if age not 18-45 for current wearers or not 18-34 for prospective adopters; terminate if working for eyecare manufacturer,practice,or market research firm; maintain quotas as specified in Sample Plan.",
          "type": "instruction",
          "options": [],
          "required": true,
          "methodology": "programming",
          "order": 1
        },
        {
          "id": "q2",
          "text": "Van Westendorp validation:Enforce logical order at data cleaning stage (Too cheap < Cheap < Expensive < Too expensive); flag non-monotonic entries; collect currency symbol based on respondent locale; store numeric values as decimals.",
          "type": "instruction",
          "options": [],
          "required": true,
          "methodology": "programming",
          "order": 2
        },
        {
          "id": "q3",
          "text": "Gabor-Granger sequence:Randomize presentation order of price points within a logical ascending set for each respondent from a pool (e.g.,$20,$25,$30,$35,$40,$45); ensure currency localization; capture 5-point purchase intent; use branching to present 4-6 price points depending on runtime length with minimum of four.",
          "type": "instruction",
          "options": [],
          "required": true,
          "methodology": "programming",
          "order": 3
        },
        {
          "id": "q4",
          "text": "Randomization:Randomize order of brand lists,attribute lists,and feature importance items; keep scale direction consistent; anchor labels visible on mobile.",
          "type": "instruction",
          "options": [],
          "required": true,
          "methodology": "programming",
          "order": 4
        },
        {
          "id": "q5",
          "text": "Quality flags:Mark respondents failing attention check or completing in less than one-third of median time; include straight-line detection for matrix; record device type,OS,and browser; prevent multiple entries by fingerprinting.",
          "type": "instruction",
          "options": [],
          "required": true,
          "methodology": "quality_control",
          "order": 5
        },
        {
          "id": "q6",
          "text": "Accessibility and mobile:Use large touch targets,one-question-per-screen on mobile,progress bar enabled,estimated time 15-20 minutes; autosave responses; allow back button except for randomized price tasks.",
          "type": "instruction",
          "options": [],
          "required": true,
          "methodology": "ux",
          "order": 6
        },
        {
          "id": "q7",
          "text": "Data outputs:Provide raw CSV and SPSS with variable map; include derived metrics:Van Westendorp intersections (PMC,OPP,IDP,RPP),Gabor-Granger demand curve and revenue-optimal price,segment-level curves by age,gender,income,region,and user type; include weights for quotas and design effects.",
          "type": "instruction",
          "options": [],
          "required": true,
          "methodology": "deliverables",
          "order": 7
        },
        {
          "id": "q8",
          "text": "Privacy:Present GDPR consent upfront,allow opt-out,anonymize open-ends by removing personal information,store data on compliant servers.",
          "type": "instruction",
          "options": [],
          "required": true,
          "methodology": "compliance",
          "order": 8
        }
      ]
    }
